intro: Parapentace tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin parapentace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
